intro: Micromeria tenuis subsp. linkii, commonly known as the narrowleaf micromeria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of tiny, pinkish-white flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to drought conditions, showcasing features such as reduced leaf surface area and deep root systems. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, facilitating its dispersal in dry environments. This subspecies is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological traits and ecological adaptations.
